name: JavaScript
title: A JavaScript cheat sheet with the most important concepts, functions, methods, and more. A complete quick reference for beginners.

cards.title: Intro
cards.body: A JavaScript cheat sheet with the most important concepts, functions, methods, and more. A complete quick reference for beginners.

cards.title: Introduction
cards.body: JavaScript is a lightweight, interpreted programming language.

cards.title: Introduction
cards.body:
• [JSON cheatsheet](/json) _(cheatsheets.zip)_
• [Regex in JavaScript](/regex#regex-in-javascript) _(cheatsheets.zip)_

cards.title: Console
Numbers
cards.code:
let amount = 6;
let price = 4.99;

cards.title: Variables
Strings
Arithmetic Operators
cards.code:
5 + 5 = 10     // Addition
10 - 5 = 5     // Subtraction
5 * 10 = 50    // Multiplication
10 / 5 = 2     // Division
10 % 5 = 0     // Modulo

cards.title: Comments
Assignment Operators
String Interpolation
let Keyword
const Keyword
if Statement
Ternary Operator
Operators
cards.code:
true || false; // true
10 > 5 || 10 > 20; // true
false || false; // false
10 > 100 || 10 > 20; // false

cards.title: Operators
cards.body: #### Logical Operator &&

cards.title: Operators
cards.code:
true && true; // true
1 > 2 && 2 > 1; // false
true && false; // false
4 === 4 && 3 > 1; // true

cards.title: Operators
cards.body: #### Comparison Operators

cards.title: Operators
cards.body: #### Logical Operator !

cards.title: Operators
Operators
cards.body: #### Nullish coalescing operator ??

cards.title: Operators
cards.code:
null ?? 'I win'; //  'I win'
undefined ?? 'Me too'; //  'Me too'

false ?? 'I lose'; //  false
0 ?? 'I lose again'; //  0
'' ?? 'Damn it'; //  ''

cards.title: else if
switch Statement
== vs ===
cards.code:
0 == false; // true
0 === false; // false, different type
1 == '1'; // true,  automatic type conversion
1 === '1'; // false, different type
null == undefined; // true
null === undefined; // false
'0' == false; // true
'0' === false; // false

cards.title: == vs ===
cards.body: The `==` just check the value, `===` check both the value and the type.

cards.title: return Keyword
Calling Functions
Function Expressions
Function Parameters
Function Declaration
Scope
Block Scoped Variables
Global Variables
let vs var
let vs var
let vs var
cards.body: `var` is scoped to the nearest function block, and `let` is scoped to the nearest enclosing block.

cards.title: Loops with closures
Loops with closures
Loops with closures
cards.body: The variable has its own copy using `let`, and the variable has shared copy using `var`.

cards.title: Arrays
Property .length
cards.code:
const numbers = [1, 2, 3, 4];

numbers.length; // 4

cards.title: Index
Array.push()
Array.push()
cards.body: Add items to the end and returns the new array length.

cards.title: Array.pop()
Array.pop()
cards.body: Remove an item from the end and returns the removed item.

cards.title: Array.shift()
cards.code:
let cats = ['Bob', 'Willy', 'Mini'];

cats.shift(); // ['Willy', 'Mini']

cards.title: Array.shift()
cards.body: Remove an item from the beginning and returns the removed item.

cards.title: Array.unshift()
Array.unshift()
cards.body: Add items to the beginning and returns the new array length.

cards.title: Array.concat()
Array.concat()
cards.body: If you want to avoid mutating your original array, you can use concat.

consoloe.log(setObj.size); // 3

cards.title: XMLHttpRequest
cards.code:
const xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
xhr.open('GET', 'mysite.com/getjson');

cards.title: XMLHttpRequest
cards.body:
`XMLHttpRequest` is a browser-level API that enables the client to script data transfers via JavaScript, NOT part of the
JavaScript language.
